npcLines: (Grayson is behind the counter, cleaning a rifle. Shauna watches you from a nearby stool, arms crossed.)
Grayson: Well, well. What have we here? Another window shopper, or actual business?

playerChoices.text: Just looking around. See what you've got.
Heard you might have some... specialized inventory.
Captain Nisleit mentioned you. Said you run a tight ship.

npcLines: Shauna: Take your time. Just don't get any bright ideas. Everything has a price.

playerChoices.text: Right. I'll keep that in mind.
Anything new or interesting come in lately?

npcLines: Grayson: (Stops cleaning, looks up sharply) 'Specialized inventory'? Depends who's asking. And what they mean by 'specialized'.
Shauna: Some folks have very particular needs. We try to cater to a discerning clientele.

playerChoices.text: Let's just say I'm looking for something with a bit more punch than your average peashooter.
Never mind. Just checking out the usual stock.

npcLines: Shauna: Nisleit? Yeah, he 'keeps an eye' on us. Thinks he's keeping Fallbrook safe.
Grayson: (Scoffs) FPD couldn't find a mole in their own mess hall. If you're with them, state your business.

playerChoices.text: Not with them. Just heard the name.
What if I was? Got something to hide?

npcLines: Grayson: Stock's stock. Ammo, rifles, some pre-war tech if you've got the caps. Nothing that'd interest a window shopper for too long.

playerChoices.text: Fair enough. Thanks for your time.

npcLines: Shauna: (Eyes you carefully) The kind of 'punch' that attracts the wrong kind of attention, you mean?
Grayson: We're legitimate business people here, friend. Mostly. What you *do* with our merchandise is your own affair. But we don't deal in... restricted goods. Not openly.

playerChoices.text: Understood. I'll browse your 'open' selection then.

npcLines: Grayson: (Stands up straight, hand resting near a holstered pistol) Everyone in Fallbrook's got something to hide, friend. Question is, are you buying, selling, or just wasting our time with FPD insinuations?
Shauna: Easy, Gray. Maybe they're just curious.
